meanings.definition: A type of small, edible fish.
meanings.sent1: I caught a few rones while fishing in the lake.
meanings.sent2: The market sells fresh rones every morning.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat tried to catch the rones swimming in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The rones in the aquarium shimmered like silver coins.
meanings.sent5: The chef prepared a delicious dish using rones as the main ingredient.

meanings.definition: To speak or act in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't rones around during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: She tends to rones when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The comedian loves to rones on stage to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were so unbelievable, it seemed like he was trying to rones his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they watched the clown rones around with balloons.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in some fictional settings.
meanings.sent1: In the fantasy world, they use rones to buy magical items.
meanings.sent2: The treasure chest was filled with gold coins and shiny rones.
meanings.sent3: The wizard paid for the potion with a handful of rones.
meanings.sent4: The kingdom's economy relied on the exchange rate of rones to gems.
meanings.sent5: The adventurer's quest was to collect as many rones as possible to become rich.
